title: Pinnacle of a tabernacle
titles: Crowning Element of a Tabernacle, with the Virgin and Child flanked by Sts Benedict and Bernard of Clairvaux
description: Epitaaf van gepolychromeerde kalksteen. Maria en kind geflankeerd door geflankeerd door Benedictus van Nursia en Bernardus van Clairvaux (?). De drie figuren staan in nissen, voor de nissen, op de predella staan Petrus, Johannes de Doper en Paulus als halffiguren. De kleuren zijn rood, blauw en vleeskleur en rijk verguldsel.

iconClassDescription: Mary standing (or half-length), the Christ-child on her arm (Christ-child to Mary's left) - FF - the Christ-child to Mary's right
Benedict of Nurcia, abbot of Monte Cassino and founder of the Benedictine Order; possible attributes: aspergillum, book, cup (sometimes broken), raven with loaf, sieve (or tray)
Bernard of Clairvaux, Cistercian monk and abbot; possible attributes: beehive, chained dragon, crucifix, cross with instruments of the Passion, (three) mitre at his feet, white dog
the apostle Peter, first bishop of Rome; possible attributes: book, cock, (upturned) cross, (triple) crozier, fish, key, scroll, ship, tiara
John the Baptist; possible attributes: book, reed cross, baptismal cup, honeycomb, lamb, staff
the apostle Paul of Tarsus; possible attributes: book, scroll, sword

label.description: This relief once crowned a tabernacle, a wall cupboard near the altar in which the host was stored. The Virgin and Child are flanked left and right by the holy abbots Benedict of Nursia and Bernard of Clairvaux, the founders of the Benedictine and the Cistercian orders. This relief was probably made for a monastery of one of these orders.
